chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 44 days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration nor Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED. COSTS AND DNA PAID IN FULL

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Sex Offender Registration.
Sex Offender treatment recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

IT IS ORDERED that the appellant shall file a statement on transcript no later than October 30, 2018.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.82(20(a).  The time for the circuit court clerk to file the record on appeal is extended accordingly.

It is ordered that unless the Statement on Transcript is filed within five days of the date of this order and a copy of the statement is served on the clerk of the circuit court, the appeal in the above matter will be subject to a penalty under Rule 809.83.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan M Simmons in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was previously found guilty at trial. State makes sentencing recommendations. Atty. Benedict makes statements. Defendant's friend makes statements. Defendant makes statements. Atty. Benedict requests the court stay the sentence pending appeal. Court denies request.

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed Sentence of:

7 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 44 days)
-	5 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

-Maintain/Obtain full time employment;

-Sex Offender registration

-Sex Offender treatment recommended by the Agent

Cost: $268.00 

DNA surcharge: $250.00 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is/not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is/not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Cash bail posted to be applied to costs and DNA Surcharge, remainder to be returned to poster.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 17, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Exhibits 1-7**Exhibit 7-DVD-Not Scannable, stored in exhibit room
and peremptory challenges
Voir Dire List and Random Listing
Preliminary Instructions and Final Jury Instructions

Defendant Jonathan M Simmons in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Detective Jicha. Atty. Benedict moves for the exclusion of witnesses. Court grants request. Court calls for jurors at 8:34 a.m. Jurors arrive at 8:51 a.m. Potential jurors sworn in. Court gives introductions and conducts Voir Dire. Scott C. is struck for cause. Court announces next potential juror. Lisa G. is struck for cause. Court announces next potential juror. Jeffrey J. is struck for cause. Court announces next potential juror. Cory O. is struck for cause. Court announces next potential juror. Joelle E. struck for cause. Court announces next potential juror. Kip W. struck for cause. Court announces next potential juror. Jereme R. is struck for cause. Court announces next potential juror. Denise G. is struck for cause. Court announces next potential juror. Parties practice peremptory challenges. Non selected jurors released at 10:30 a.m. Selected jurors sworn in. Jurors released for a short break at 10:32 a.m. Court addresses conversations off the record. Court takes short break at 10:32 a.m. Court reconvenes at 10:42 a.m. Same appearances, jurors called in. Court reads preliminary instructions. State gives opening statements. Atty. Benedict gives opening statements. State calls Detective Andrew Jicha to the stand. Sworn in and testifies. State offers exhibits 1-2. Jurors released for lunch at 12:17 p.m. Court reconvenes at 1:20 p.m. Same appearances, jurors are not present. Jurors called in at 1:27 p.m. State continues direct examination. State offers exhibit 3. Cross examination by the Defense. Defense offers exhibit 4. Redirect by the State. No further questions from the Defense. Witness is excused. State moves for the admission of exhibits 1-3. No objection. Defense moves for the admission of exhibit 4. No objection. Court receives exhibits 1-4. State calls Detective Cory Koeppel to the stand. Sworn in and testifies. State offers exhibits 5 and 6. Cross examination by the Defense. Court takes short break at 2:17 p.m. Court reconvenes at 2:25 p.m. Same appearances, jurors called in. Atty. Benedict plays DVD of interview with defendant, marked as exhibit 7. Jurors excused at 3:12 p.m. for court to address issues with the parties. Court reconvenes at 3:17 p.m. Redirect by the State. No further questions from the Defense. Witness is excused. State moves for the admission of exhibits 5 and 6. No objection. Defense moves for the admission of exhibit 7. No objection. Court receives exhibits 5-7. State rests. Jurors excused at 3:22 p.m. Defense moves for the dismissal of the case. State objects. For reasons set out on the record, the Court will deny the motion to dismiss. Defense rests. The defendant has elected not to testify. Court takes a break at 3:29 p.m. Court reconvenes at 3:36. Same appearances, jurors are not present. Court reviews jury instructions with the parties. Jurors called in at 3:52 p.m. Defense announces, in the presence of the jury, that the defense has rested. Testimony is closed. Court reads jury instructions. State gives closing arguments. Defense gives closing arguments. Civilian Bailiff sworn in. Jurors released for deliberations at 4:52 p.m. Jurors advise that they have a verdict at 5:20 p.m. Jurors called in at 5:22 p.m. Court reads the verdict. The jury finds the defendant Guilty of Count #1. Court polls the jury. Jurors released at 5:27 p.m. Court sets for sentencing. State moves for judgment on the verdict. Court enters judgment. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
